A Multiagent-Based Peer-to-Peer Network
in Java for Distributed Spam Filtering
Jörg Metzger, Michael Schillo, and Klaus Fischer
German Research Center for Artificial Intelligence
Stuhlsatzenhausweg 3, 66123 Saarbrücken, Germany
{jmetzger,schillo,kuf}@dfki.de
http://www.dfki.de/
Abstract.
With the growing amount of internet users, a negative form
of sending email spreads that affects more and more users of email ac-
counts: Spamming. Spamming means that the electronic mailbox is con-
gested with unwanted advertising or personal email. Sorting out this
email costs the user time and money. This paper introduces a distributed
spam filter, which combines an off-the-shelf text classification with mul-
tiagent systems. Both the text classification as well as the multiagent
platform are implemented in Java. The content of the emails is analyzed
by the classification algorithm 'support vector machines'. Information
about spam is exchanged between the agents through the network. Iden-
tification numbers for emails which where identified as spam are gener-
ated and forwarded to all other agents connected to the network. These
numbers allow agents to identify incoming spam email. In this way, the
quality of the filter increases continuously.
V. Mařík et al. (Eds): CEEMAS 2003, LNAI 2691, pp. 616-625, 2003.
